questions.question: Which of the following statements is true concerning phospholipids?

choices.answer: The heads face inward in a cell membrane.
They are referred to as the "mosaic" of the membrane.
They allow non-polar molecules to simply diffuse through the membrane.
They facilitate the movement of monomers through the membrane.

questions.question: How can one distinguish a plant cell from an animal cell through the microscope?

choices.answer: A plant cell will have a nucleus.
Plant cells have a regular shape due to the presence of a cell wall.
A plant cell has many small water vacuoles.
Plant cells are smaller and circular in structure.

questions.question: Which of the following structures are found in all cells?
Endocytosis and Exocytosis are forms of facilitated diffusion?
Which of the following represents a function of cholesterol in the cell membrane?

choices.answer: To adjust the fluidity of the membrane.
To allow water to diffuse through the membrane.
To facilitate the passage of polar molecules through the membrane.
To provide an anchoring point for enzymes.

questions.question: A cell containing 10% glucose is place in a solution containing 5% starch.  What will occur?

choices.answer: Glucose will move out of the cell and starch will move into the cell.
Glucose will move into the cell.
Water will move into the cell.
Water and glucose will move out of the cell.

questions.question: A cell place in a hypotonic solution will shrink in size.
Ions move into and out of a cell with the help of protein carriers.
Which of the following statements is false concerning energy processes in a cell?

choices.answer: Both photosynthesis and cellular respiration are energy transformations.
An exothermic reaction must be coupled to an endothermic reaction to run.
As energy transformations occur in a cell, some energy is released as heat.
Energy can never be created or destroyed.

questions.question: Which of the following factors has the greatest impact on speed of movement through the cell membrane?
Which of the following statements is false concerning cellular respiration?

choices.answer: Cellular respiration only occurs in heterotrophs
Cellular respiration occurs in the mitochondria.
The purpose of cellular respiration is to recycle ATP from ADP and Pi.
Cellular respiration is an exothermic process.

questions.question: Which of the following cell structures is incorrectly paired with its function?
Which of the following is not an example of active transport?
A cell which is losing water is in a hypertonic environment.
Both the chloroplast and the mitochondria have large internal membrane structures.
Which of the following molecules would move through the cell membrane the quickest?
What is the cell wall of a plant cell composed of?
Peripheral proteins can act as ion channels in a membrane.
Which of the following statements is false concerning photosynthesis?

choices.answer: It only occurs in plant cells.
It is an endothermic process dependent on sunlight.
Its products are glucose and O<sub>2</sub>.
It transforms light energy into chemical energy.

questions.question: What controls which molecules can enter different cells is the mosaic of proteins embedded in the cell membrane.
Which of the following statements is incorrect?

choices.answer: Phagocytosis and pinocytosis involve a change in the shape of the membrane.
Simple diffusion is the result of molecules possessing kinetic energy.
Osmosis is a form of simple diffusion.
ATP energy is needed to run carrier molecules.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true of osmosis?

choices.answer: Osmosis is the movement of water.
A cell in an isotonic solution will not change size.
A cell in a hypotonic solution will shrink in size.
Water moves from high to low solute concentration.

questions.question: Pumps and channels are examples of integral proteins.
Which of the following statements is true of ATP?

choices.answer: ATP possesses more energy than glucose.
The last phosphate group is attached by a high energy bond.
ATP has two phosphate groups and an inorganic phosphate.
The recycling of ATP is an exothermic reaction.

questions.question: The purpose of coupling reactions is to provide energy to run exothermic reactions.
